+License-File: LICENSE
+
+============================
+Beta-adic tools and automata
+============================
+
+The badic package for SageMath add functionalities related to beta-adic sets, i.e. sets of the form
+{ a_0 + a_1*b + a_2*b^2 + ... + a_n*b^n | n in N, a_0 a_1 ... a_n in L }
+where b is a number, and L is a regular language (over an alphabet in the same ring as b).
+This permits to do computation and drawing with Rauzy fractals and many other fractals.
+It also permits to manipulate efficiently automata written in C language (mainly deterministic automata).
+It installs on top of an existing Sage installation (tested on versions 8.1 and 8.8).
+
+This package is based on `SageMath <http://www.sagemath.org>`_
+
+Prerequisites
+-------------
+
+Installing the package badic requires a working Sage installation (with Cython and gcc).
+
+It is recommanded (but not necessary) to install the dot command of Graphiz, in order to
+have nice plots of automata.
+If you want to use the functions draw_zoom() and user_draw() of BetaAdicSet, you need to
+install the SDL2 library (developpement version) in your system before installing the badic package.
+Both library can be installed in Linux with the command line
+
+	$ sudo apt install libsdl2-dev graphviz
+
+Installation
+------------
+
+The module is distributed on PyPI. You just need to run the following command::
+
+    $ sage -pip install badic [--user]
+
+The --user option is optional and allows to install the module in your user space
+(and does not require administrator rights).
+
+Remark: If you don't have SSL installed, the previous command may not work.
+If it is the case, you can download the file badic-x.x.x.tar.gz from https://pypi.org/project/badic/#files
+Then, extract the files (you will get a folder badic-x.x.x), and then use the command
+
+	$ sage -pip install badic-x.x.x/ --user
+	
+(replace badic-x.x.x/ by the location of the folder extracted)
+
+Documentation
+-------------
+
+* examples of Sage worksheets using the package badic:
+	http://www.i2m.univ-amu.fr/perso/paul.mercat/RauzyFractals/
+
+* tutorial about beta-adic sets (not up-to-date, functions names may have changed):
+	http://www.i2m.univ-amu.fr/perso/paul.mercat/RauzyFractals/html/beta_adic_set.html
+
+* tutorial about automata and regular languages (not up-to-date, functions names may have changed):
+	http://www.i2m.univ-amu.fr/perso/paul.mercat/RauzyFractals/html/language_automaton.html
+
+Check
+-----
+
+After installing badic, check that it works by launching Sage
+and typing the following commands. You should get the same
+output as below.::
+
+    sage: from badic import *
+    sage: m = BetaAdicSet(1/(1+I), [0,1])
+    sage: m.plot()                  # this should plot the dragon fractal
+    
+    sage: mi = m.intersection_words([0], [1]); mi
+    b-adic set with b root of x^2 - x + 1/2, and an automaton of 21 states and 2 letters
+    sage: mi.plot(nprec=8)          # this should plot a part of the boundary of the dragon fractal
+    sage: mi.critical_exponent()    # compute the Hausdorff dimension of the boundary of the dragon fractal
+    log(y)/log(1.414213562373095?) where y is the max root of x^3 - x^2 - 2, and 1.414213562373095? is root of x^2 - 2.
+    1.523627086202492
+    
+    sage: from badic.beta_adic import *
+    sage: s = WordMorphism('a->ab,b->ca,c->a')  # define a substitution
+    sage: m = DumontThomas(s).mirror(); m    # take the corresponding beta-adic set
+    b-adic set with b root of x^3 - x^2 - x - 1, and an automaton of 3 states and 2 letters
+    sage: m.plot()      # should plot the Rauzy fractal of the substitution s
+    sage: m.draw_zoom() # permits to zoom in the Rauzy fractal (works only if SDL2 was installed)
+    
+    sage: a = dag.AnyWord(['a','b']).concat(dag.Word('abca')); a    # define an automaton
+    DetAutomaton with 5 states and an alphabet of 3 letters

+void StronglyConnectedComponents3 (Automaton a, int *res)
+{
+	int i, e, f, j, k;
+	int *m = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*a.n); // valeur attribue aux sommets
+	for (i=0;i<a.n;i++)

+		res[i] = -1;

+	int *se = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*a.n); // tats
+	int *sj = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*a.n); // arte de l'tat
+	int *sc = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*a.n); // numro initial attribu  l'tat
+	int n; // nombre d'lments dans la pile
+	int ncc = 0; // numro courant de composante fortement connexe
+	int c = 0; // numro courant
+	for (i=0;i<a.n;i++)
+	{
+		//printf("Starting vertex %d...\n", i);
+		if (m[i] == -1)
+		{
+			se[0] = i;
+			sj[0] = 0;
+			n = 1;
+			pile[0] = i;
+			np = 1;
+			while (n > 0)
+			{
+				// pop
+				e = se[n-1];
+				j = sj[n-1];
+				n--;
+				/*
+				printf("e=%d, j=%d, m[e]=%d\n", e, j, m[e]);
+				//
+				printf("pile = [");
+				for (k=0;k<np;k++)
+				{
+					printf("%d", pile[k]);

+						printf(", ");
+				}
+				printf("]\n");
+				
+				printf("m = [");
+				for (k=0;k<a.n;k++)
+				{
+					printf("%d", m[k]);
+					if (k < a.n-1)
+						printf(", ");
+				}
+				printf("]\n");
+				*/
+				//
+				if (m[e] == -1)
+				{
+					m[e] = c;
+					sc[e] = c;
+					c++;
+				}
+				// increment
+				if (j < a.na)
+				{
+					// push the next one
+					sj[n] = j+1;
+					n++;
+				}else
+				{
+					// on a parcouru tous les fils de ce sommet
+					if (m[e] == sc[e])
+					{ // strongly connected component found !
+						//pops the component
+						do

+							np--;

+								m[se[n-1]] = m[e];

+						sj[n] = 0;
+						se[n] = f;
+						n++;

+					}else

+						if (m[e] > m[f] && res[f] == -1)

+Automaton Lpriv_subgraph (Automaton *a, int *l, int n)
+{
+	Automaton r = NewAutomaton(a->n, a->na);
+	int i,j;
+	int b;
+	int *indL = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a->na);
+	for (i=0;i<a->na;i++)
+	{
+		indL[i] = 0;
+	}
+	for (i=0;i<n;i++)
+	{
+		indL[l[i]] = 1;
+	}
+	for (i=0;i<a->n;i++)
+	{
+		b = 0;
+		for (j=0;j<n;j++)
+		{
+			if (a->e[i].f[l[j]] != -1)
+			{
+				b = 1; // there is an edge labeled in L
+				break;
+			}
+		}
+		for (j=0;j<a->na;j++)
+		{
+			if (b && indL[j] == 0)
+			{
+				r.e[i].f[j] = -1;
+			}else
+				r.e[i].f[j] = a->e[i].f[j];
+		}
+		r.e[i].final = a->e[i].final;
+	}
+	free(indL);
+	r.i = a->i;
+	return r;
+}

+// Check the Fougeron's criterion for the subset of letters L
+int CheckL (Automaton *a, int *l, int n, int verb)
+{
+	Automaton a2 = Lpriv_subgraph(a, l, n);
+	int *cc = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a->n);
+	int nc = StronglyConnectedComponents(a2, cc);
+	int i, j, f, c;
+	int *indL = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a->na);
+	int *cs = NULL; // list of critical states
+	int ncs = 0;
+	int r = 1;
+	for (i=0;i<a->na;i++)
+	{
+		indL[i] = 0;
+	}
+	for (i=0;i<n;i++)
+	{
+		indL[l[i]] = 1;
+	}
+	if (verb)
+	{
+		/*
+		printf("cc = [");
+		for (i=0;i<a->n;i++)
+		{
+			printf("%d ", cc[i]);
+		}
+		printf("]\n");
+		*/
+		printf("L = [ ");
+		for (i=0;i<n;i++)
+		{
+			printf("%d ", l[i]);
+		}
+		printf("]\n");
+	}
+	// find critical states
+	for (i=0;i<a->n;i++)
+	{
+		c = 0;
+		for (j=0;j<n;j++)
+		{
+			f = a->e[i].f[l[j]];
+			if (f != -1)
+			{
+				c++;
+				if (cc[i] != cc[f])
+					break; // we can leave from this state
+			}
+		}
+		if (j >= n)
+		{
+			if (c > 1)
+			{
+				if (verb)
+					printf("state %d is critical\n", i);
+				// critical state found !
+				if (ncs == 0)
+				{
+					cs = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a->n);
+				}
+				cs[ncs] = i;
+				ncs++;
+			}
+		}
+	}
+	if (!ncs)
+	{
+		if (verb)
+			printf("No critical state !\n");
+	}else
+	{
+		if (verb)
+		{
+			printf("%d critical states : [ ", ncs);
+			for (i=0;i<ncs;i++)
+			{
+				printf("%d ", cs[i]);
+			}
+			printf("]\n");
+		}
+		// find states of a2 from which we can leave in one step
+		int *t = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a2.n);
+		int *to_see = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a2.n);
+		int e;
+		int nts = 0;
+		for (i=0;i<a2.n;i++)
+		{
+			//printf("i=%d...\n", i);
+			t[i] = 0;
+			c = 0;
+			for (j=0;j<n;j++)
+			{
+				f = a2.e[i].f[l[j]];
+				if (f != -1)
+				{
+					c++;
+					if (cc[i] != cc[f])
+					{
+						t[i] = 1; // there is an edge in L going out of the component
+						break;
+					}
+				}
+			}
+			if (c == 0)
+			{ // all outgoing edges are in the complement of L
+				//printf("all edges in complement...\n");
+				t[i] = 1;
+				for (j=0;j<a2.na;j++)
+				{
+					f = a2.e[i].f[j];
+					if (f != -1)
+					{
+						c++;
+						if (cc[i] == cc[f])
+						{
+							t[i]--;
+						}
+					}
+				}
+				if (c == 0)
+				{
+					fprintf(stderr, "Error : the L-priviledge subgraph is incorrect !\n");
+					return 0;
+				}
+			}
+			if (t[i] == 1)
+			{
+				to_see[nts] = i;
+				nts++;
+			}
+		}
+		if (verb)
+		{
+			printf("states that can leave immediatly : [ ");
+			for (i=0;i<a2.n;i++)
+			{
+				if (t[i] == 1)
+				{
+					printf("%d ", i);
+				}
+			}
+			printf("]\n");
+		}
+		// compute the mirror of a2
+		NAutomaton am = Mirror(a2);
+		// browse the graph am from every states i such that t[i] = 1
+		while (nts > 0)
+		{
+			if (verb)
+			{
+				printf("to_see = [ ");
+				for (i=0;i<nts;i++)
+				{
+					printf("%d ", to_see[i]);
+				}
+				printf("]\n");
+			}
+			// pop a state to see
+			nts--;
+			e = to_see[nts];
+			// browse from e
+			for (j=0;j<am.e[e].n;j++)
+			{
+				f = am.e[e].a[j].e;
+				if (cc[e] != cc[f])
+					continue;
+				if (indL[am.e[e].a[j].l])
+				{
+					if (!t[f])
+					{
+						t[f] = 1;
+						to_see[nts] = f;
+						nts++;
+					}
+				}else
+				{
+					t[f]++;
+					if (t[f] == 1)
+					{
+						// every outgoing edge of f permits to leave the strongly connected component
+						to_see[nts] = f;
+						nts++;
+					}
+				}
+			}
+		}
+		if (verb)
+		{
+			printf("t = [ ");
+			for (i=0;i<a2.n;i++)
+			{
+				printf("%d ", t[i]);
+			}
+			printf("]\n");
+		}
+		// check that we can leave from every critical state
+		for (i=0;i<ncs;i++)
+		{
+			if (t[cs[i]] != 1)
+			{
+				if (verb)
+				{
+					printf("There is no strategy to leave from critical state %d.\n", cs[i]);
+				}
+				r = 0;
+				break;
+			}
+		}
+		free(t);
+		free(to_see);
+		FreeNAutomaton(&am);
+	}
+	if (ncs)
+		free(cs);
+	free(indL);
+	free(cc);
+	FreeAutomaton(&a2);
+	return r;
+}

+// check that from every state we can reach any label
+int CanReachAllLabels (Automaton *a)
+{
+	int i,j,c,f;
+	int *cc = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a->n);
+	int nc = StronglyConnectedComponents(*a, cc);
+	int *term = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*nc);
+	int **ls = (int **)malloc(sizeof(int *)*nc); // letters seen in each scc
+	for (i=0;i<nc;i++)
+	{
+		term[i] = 1;
+		ls[i] = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a->na);
+		for (j=0;j<a->na;j++)
+			ls[i][j] = 0;
+	}
+	for (i=0;i<a->n;i++)
+	{
+		for (j=0;j<a->na;j++)
+		{
+			f = a->e[i].f[j];
+			if (f != -1)
+			{
+				c = cc[i];
+				if (c != cc[f])
+				{
+					term[c] = 0;
+				}else
+				{
+					ls[c][j] = 1;
+				}
+			}
+		}
+	}
+	int r = 1;
+	for (i=0;i<nc;i++)
+	{
+		if (term[i] && r)
+		{
+			for (j=0;j<a->na;j++)
+			{
+				if (!ls[i][j])
+				{
+					r = 0;
+					break;
+				}
+			}
+		}
+		free(ls[i]);
+	}
+	free(ls);
+	free(term);
+	free(cc);
+	return r;
+}
+
+// test if the graph satisfies the Fougeron's criterion
+int FougeronCriterion (Automaton *a, int verb)
+{
+	int j, n, r;
+	unsigned long long i;
+	if (a->na > sizeof(unsigned long long))
+	{
+		fprintf(stderr, "Error : too much differents letters to compute Fougeron's criterion !!!\n");
+		return 0;
+	}
+	if (!CanReachAllLabels(a))
+	{
+		if (verb)
+		{
+			printf("There is a state from which we cannot reach every labels.\n");
+		}
+		return 0;
+	}
+	const unsigned long long m = (unsigned long long)1 << a->na;
+	int *l = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*a->na);
+	unsigned long long i2;
+	// browse the possible L
+	r = 1;
+	for (i=1;i<m-1;i++)
+	{
+		// count the number of elements of L
+		n = 0;
+		i2 = i;
+		for (j=0;j<a->na;j++)
+		{
+			if (i2%2)
+			{
+				l[n] = j;
+				n++;
+			}
+			i2 = i2 >> 1;
+		}
+		if (n < 2)
+			continue;
+		if (!CheckL(a, l, n, verb))
+		{
+			if (verb)
+			{
+				i2 = i;
+				printf("Criterion not satisfied for L = [ ");
+				for (j=0;j<n;j++)
+				{
+					printf("%d ", l[j]);
+				}
+				printf("]\n");
+			}
+			r = 0;
+			break;
+		}
+	}
+	free(l);
+	return r;
+}
+
+// convert a win-lose graph to graph with full comparaison written in each edge
+// !!!!!!!! assume the graph has arity 2 !!!!!!!!!
+Automaton RelabelFougeron2 (Automaton *a)
+{
+	Automaton r = NewAutomaton(a->n, a->na*a->na);
+	int i,j,k;
+	int lab[2];
+	int ia;
+	for (i=0;i<a->n;i++)
+	{
+		ia = 0;
+		for (j=0;j<a->na;j++)
+		{
+			k = a->e[i].f[j];
+			if (k != -1)
+			{
+				if (ia >= 2)
+				{
+					printf("error\n");
+					fprintf(stderr, "Error : the graph has more than two leaving edges from state %d !\n", i);
+					return r;
+				}
+				lab[ia] = j;
+				ia++;
+			}
+		}
+		if (ia < 2)
+		{
+			printf("error\n");
+			fprintf(stderr, "Error : the graph has less than two leaving edges from state %d !\n", i);
+			return r;
+		}
+		r.e[i].f[lab[0]+lab[1]*a->na] = a->e[i].f[lab[0]];
+		r.e[i].f[lab[1]+lab[0]*a->na] = a->e[i].f[lab[1]];
+		r.e[i].final = 1;
+	}
+	return r;
+}
+
+Automaton Fougeron2FromRelabel (Automaton *a)
+{
+	int d = sqrt(a->na);
+	Automaton r = NewAutomaton(a->n, d);
+	int i,j,k;
+	for (i=0;i<a->n;i++)
+	{
+		for (j=0;j<a->na;j++)
+		{
+			k = a->e[i].f[j];
+			if (k != -1)
+			{
+				r.e[i].f[j%d] = k;
+			}
+		}
+		r.e[i].final = 1;
+	}
+	return r;
+}
+
+double InvariantDensityApprox(NAutomaton *a, int i, int** A, int* lA, double* v, int na, int n) //, int verb=0)
+{
+	double **vstack; // stack of vectors
+	double *cv; // current vector
+	double *nv; // current next vector
+	double *t; // buffer vector
+	int *istack; // stack of states
+	int *kstack; // stack of edges
+	int nstack = 1; // current size of the stack
+	double sum = 0; // the result
+	double s;
+	int j,k,l;
+	//printf("i = %d, na = %d, n = %d", i, na, n);
+	//printf("alloc...\n");
+	//fflush(stdout);
+	// allocate memory
+	vstack = (double**)malloc(sizeof(double*)*n);
+	istack = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*n);
+	kstack = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*n);
+	for (k=0;k<n;k++)
+	{
+		vstack[k] = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double)*na);
+	}
+	t = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double)*na);
+	// stack the first element
+	istack[0] = i;
+	kstack[0] = 0;
+	for (k=0;k<na;k++)
+	{
+		vstack[0][k] = v[k];
+	}
+	
+	while (nstack > 0)
+	{
+		// unstack
+		nstack--;
+		i = istack[nstack];
+		k = kstack[nstack];
+		if (k < a->e[i].n)
+		{
+			cv = vstack[nstack];
+			//printf("i=%d, k=%d, cv=[%lf, %lf, %lf], nstack=%d\n", i, k, cv[0], cv[1], cv[2], nstack);
+			if (nstack == n-1)
+				nv = t;
+			else
+				nv = vstack[nstack+1];
+			// compute nv from cv
+			for (j=0;j<na;j++)
+				nv[j] = cv[j];
+			l = a->e[i].a[k].l;
+			if (l >= a->na)
+				printf("l=%d >= %d = na !!!\n", l, a->na);
+			for (j=1;j<lA[l];j++)
+			{
+				if (A[l][j] >= na)
+					printf("Error !!!!!\n");
+				nv[A[l][j]] += cv[A[l][0]];
+			}
+			kstack[nstack]++;
+			if (nstack == n-1)
+			{
+				// add to the sum
+				s = 0;
+				for (k=0;k<na;k++)
+					s += nv[k];
+				//printf("sum(nv)=%lf\n", s);
+				sum += pow(s, -na);
+				//printf("sum = %lf\n", sum);
+			}else
+			{
+				// stack the next element
+				nstack++;
+				istack[nstack] = a->e[i].a[k].e;
+				kstack[nstack] = 0;
+			}
+			nstack++;
+		}
+	}
+	
+	// free memory
+	free(t);
+	for (k=0;k<n;k++)
+	{
+		free(vstack[k]);
+	}
+	free(kstack);
+	free(istack);
+	free(vstack);
+	//
+	s = 0;
+	for (k=0;k<na;k++)
+		s += v[k];
+	//printf("sum(v) = %lf\n", s);
+	//printf("sum = %lf\n", sum);
+	sum *= pow(s,na);
+	//printf("sum = %lf\n", sum);
+	return sum;
+}
+
+void TestMemLeak (int size)
+{
+	int **t = (int **)malloc(sizeof(int*)*size);
+	int i,j;
+	printf("do a memory of size %ld\n", (long)size*size);
+	for (i=0;i<size;i++)
+	{
+		if (i%2)
+		{
+			t[i] = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*size);
+			for (j=0;j<size;j++)
+			{
+				t[i][j] = i+j;
+			}
+		}
+	}
+	printf("end\n");
+}
+
